wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier-General Henry R Cook was an early British aviator and an officer in the Royal Artillery during World War I. He was the first Assistant Commandant of the Central Flying School in the years before the war.

link_mentions.page: List of pilots awarded an Aviator's Certificate by the Royal Aero Club in 1911

response: * Henry Cook (aviator), early British aviator and Royal Artillery officer
